importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game that forced Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a pivotal moment in the postseason.
Six days prior to the game, the Mariners scored five runs in four innings against Yesavage in Game 2, indicating a turning point in his performance and confidence.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The six-day period between Game 2 and Game 7 highlights a critical shift in the Mariners' performance and Yesavage's growing composure.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run in the postseason, a key moment that extended the Blue Jays' lead and forced Game 7.
The Mariners committed three errors in the second inning, two of which were consecutive, leading to early runs for Toronto.
Toronto's 6-2 victory over Seattle in Game 6 of the ALCS forces a Game 7, marking the Mariners' first-ever Game 7 in team history.
The Blue Jays' victory is their first ALCS Game 7 since 1985, highlighting the historical significance of the matchup.
Right-handed pitcher Trey Yesavage delivered a strong performance with 31 splitters, seven strikeouts, and only six hits and three walks, showing growth and composure in high-pressure play.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners lost Game 6 and now face elimination in the ALCS, marking their first-ever Game 7 in franchise history.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a pivotal Game 6 of the 2025 American League Championship Series, the Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2, forcing a decisive Game 7. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth postseason homer, contributing to the Blue Jays’ dominant performance. The Mariners’ season-high three errors—two in the second inning—proved costly, with fielding mistakes by Julio Rodríguez and Eugenio Suárez allowing early runs. Despite a solo homer from Josh Naylor in the sixth, the Mariners could not recover after a wild pitch by Matt Brash in the seventh gave the Blue Jays a 6-2 lead. The Blue Jays’ win marks their first ALCS Game 7 since 1985, while the Mariners face their first-ever Game 7. The winner of this series will advance to the World Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
